Bare bones, the sushi is good and the space is cozy, but even with a reservation I wouldn't go back on a weekend.
author: Shannon B.

description:
This place is amazing for the novice and the seasoned Sushi eater.  The restaurant is small but informative.  The food is prepared at the bar and expertly so, amazingly fresh and fabulous to eat.  

Took my girlfriend here and she hadn't had Sushi before so told the waiter to choose the dishes for us, a little like tapas, and said to keep them coming until I told him to stop.  Each dish was explained before ate, she didn't use chopsticks but the were perfectly happy for her to use her fingers to eat, bringing out a hot towel to ensure her hands were clean.  Nice touch.  

Recommend you check this place out if you wish to try Sushi.
author: Kevin S.

description: Parking wasn't easy to find. Resturant was small but wasn't packed with people to make it uncomfortable. I felt their pricing was high for quality of food. Service was friendly and attentive.
author: J C.

description: This place is fantastic. Creative rolls, fresh fish, incredibly reasonable prices given the quality of the food. We paid under $30/person and ordered nearly every special roll of the day. My meter for the quality of a sushi restaurant, however, is the uni. Their uni rolls were amazing--the perfect balance of flavor and texture. I've been itching to go back for weeks now. The restaurant is tiny, though, so be prepared to wait for a bit, and the service was imperfect, but the food is definitely worth it. This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in the country.
author: Koyel B.

description: Amazing and accommodating service!  We went to O-Toro on a Tuesday night before going to the theater.  There were no reservations available on opentable for our party of five, so we figured we'd just show up and see what happened.  What happened was that they went above and beyond to make sure that we were able to enjoy our meal and make it to our show on time!  Although I didn't confirm it that night, I'm guessing it was the manager - and/or maybe the owner - who helped us out at O-Toro that night.  It was clear that his priority was to ensure that his guests had a great experience.  And he did just that!  We'll definitely go back.
author: Ann M.

description:
Service is excellent- the host makes sure to pay attention to each guest so they get what they need. We had a reservation for 9:15 and were seated on the dot, in spite of how busy the small restaurant was. This place continues to be one of my favorite sushi joints in the city because they treat you so well and the food is so fresh.

The hot house sake was not very good... if you like sake splurge and get a full bottle. 

But, all the food is wonderful.

The toro and butter fish were both super fresh with lovely texture. The rolls are nicely proportioned- not bites so big that you can't fit the whole thing in your mouth. The chef is also really accommodating- they'll really make you anything you'd like if they have the components. 

Overall simple, delicious, fresh food. So yummy.

Also, the black sesame ice cream for dessert is super creamy goodness.
author: Louisa B.

description:
*** 2/12/2011 ***

Ever since they've opened, I have been back many times.  My most recent visit was about a month ago on a ballet night.  Even after almost two years, I see that the operations and the food has remained consistent.  This is why I am upgrading them to a four stars.  They have consistently showed me that I can go there, order either a special or something on the menu, and I would get the same good quality.  

*** 5/18/2009 ***
A new sushi joint in the neighborhood and I am loving it.  Otoro has a contemporary decor with good raw fish.  The key to the place is not to just order from the menu but to ask for whatever you like.  If you like himachi, ask the waiter for a special roll with that as the main ingredient.  If you like monkfish, get the monkfish liver pate (yummy!).  Whatever your heart desires, just ask and see if they can make it.  

I will definitely go back there but I will never try to order just from the menu.
author: Carmen C.

description:
How often does one luck out on scoring a good sushi place in their hood? Not very! We have 2 in Hayes, one is way to outrageously overpriced, the other has the worst service known to man.
Otoro fit the bill perfectly, nice ambiance (even for lunch), fresh & delicious sushi and reasonable prices. We had a lot of sashimi from the menu and a few things you typically have to ask for, all of which were amazing. I especially enjoyed the hamachi carpaccio with serrano, pea sprouts and itty bitty tomatoes. 
Sake and soju drinks, beer and wine only...but they have an excellent sake selection.
I found the service to be very typical of a Japanese/sushi joint and will be back soon.
author: Colleen B.

description:
I have to provide some respect to Otoro. They are not the absolute freshest or the perfect sushi place by any means, but if you know what to order then you will leave satisfied. The chefs are chatty and apt and the owner is one of the most generous people I've encountered in awhile!

1st time we stopped by everyone at the bar was given a free leechee martini for dessert. We were also comped a free beer. Very cool! 2nd time they put up with my GF being crazy loud and drunk & still gave us a free lechee martini! The 3rd was a normal night w/ no freebees but the same Japanese Mom and Daughter pair were there from the 1st time we visited. Which may say something good about the place (or they may be related to someone there). We left satisfied with the meal though.

The atmosphere is lighthearted but suave. This is one of few sushi places where I feel the apps and hot food is equal to the fish. Black Cod dish is highly recommended! Charred Hamachi Belly for fish is excellent! many plates are fairly good and the specials are well thought out. Stop by and try it out for yourself sometime.

Recommended!
author: Nick V.

description:
Looking for great fish on the cheap, then Otoro has you covered. I assume the low-end prices are because it's relatively new and trying to gain popularity. But whatever the reason, I love it. Nigiri sushi seems to range from about $3-5 for 2 pieces. I just had the basic sake sushi (salmon), and it was incredibly fatty and soft as butter, some of the best I've had outside of Tokyo for the price. Will try the tuna/toro next time...

Also had the miso ramen (mediocre, but not terrible). It's huge, decent broth, flavorless noodles with decent texture, giant chunks of pork (didn't really like that...maybe I'm just used to the traditional thin slices). Anyhow, you can get a much better bowl at Katana-Ya near the Clift hotel in SF.

Another time, had the vegetable soba, which was quite good, but a tad salty. I'd have it again, though.

For the fish, this place -- so far-- is definitely a winner! Let's hope the prices stay low!!
author: Chris M.

description: SOOOO yummy! I am addicted to their Udon, and their Agadashi Tofu and Vegetable Caterpillar roll are as good as it gets (I'm vegetarian). Not to mention the staff is great, and Jimmy (the owner/manager) is super sweet. Wonderful neighborhood spot. I go at least once a week!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
1. make reservations - this place is small. if there aren't reservations and it's primetime on a friday or sat. night you probably won't get a seat.

2. food is SO GOOD. the truffle hamachi was SO delish (ok fine - truffle sauce is like crack). the lollipop something or other was really good (although I thought the dipping sauce left something to be desired), and the rolls we got were SO good. Overall, there wasn't anything I was mediocre about, and everything tasted SO fresh.

3. a little pricey for the amount of food we got - $100 worth of fishies later, and I was still a littlllee hungry. 

Overall, would definitely go back here, especially w/ my bonus check!
author: Megha A.

description:
Too expensive. Rude bald man. I asked him questions and he acted like my I was wasting his time. They leave food wait for awhile.
Some are left (raw sashimi and nigiri too) near hot stove.
Tempura appetizer is soso. garlic albacore was great. Regular tuna and ika was okay too. Sushi chef tried to help as much as possible but I lost my appetite from the bald guy.
author: Seung H.

description:
Dined here a week ago. I made an opentable reservation early in the day and still had to wait for an hour, unfortunately. When we did make it to our table, the sushi rolls arrived quickly and were quite good! We had a few specialty rolls.

(Very smart of them to give us that free order of sesame ice cream at the end of the meal!)
author: Sheila B.

description:
Pretty good, but not great. 

I love the piping hot Japanese tea, the cute, modern decor and the sushi bar, and the ambiance of the restaurant.

Didn't like as much the long wait it took for our food to come out because they waited to put everything (4 rolls of sushi) onto one plate, which is nice because then we could tuck in and know that everything was there, but not as nice when you're hungry and would prefer to get the first roll that comes out.

The sushi was good, but not spectacular. Nothing really stood out, and the crab from the spider roll wasn't very crunchy and had way too much hard shell on it that I had to keep removing from my mouth.

We capped dinner off with a serving of black sesame ice cream, which was aaaahhh-mazing! Yum!
author: Cheryl F.

description: Have come here about 5 times in the past 2 years. It has always been good. The wait on weekends can be a pain, so make a reservation. Besides sushi they also have other traditional Japanese foods such as skewers and ramen.
author: Frank L.

description: Smooth, silky walu, aji, succulent hotate, awesome specials, healthy portions, impressive sake selection, and Jimmy!  These are a few of my favorite things about Otoro. (Seriously, order the walu. You will understand why I love this place so much.)  I have been going to Otoro forever and have never been disappointed. The service is unbeatable and the food is fresh. Jimmy is the most gracious and accomodating host - he makes honest recommendations and never steers us wrong. It is an intimate place, nonpretentious, and within walking distance to fun bars. Great date spot, and even a great spot to gather with friends.
author: Candid K.

description:
REALLY delicious.

Otoro Sushi is comfortable swank... that is even with the Bebel Gilberto music, candles and modern decor the hubby and I walked in with jeans and flip flops and felt totally at ease. 

We ordered several rolls but what stood out the most was the grilled hamachi jalapeno, lava roll and cherry blossom roll. We also ordered the butterfish nigiri which was super fresh and moist. 

Service was friendly/professional and honest... when asked our server let us know what her favourite rolls were and was patient in describing the differences between the rolls.

The quality of the fish was pretty darn high and the cost was reasonable (high end rolls were $12.95, average rolls $9 and nigiri was $3.95... special rolls are all different). 

Very happy to find them in the neighborhood ... and the only reason we found them is because of Yelp! (They're on Oak Street, a busy street, true, but not exactly a high foot traffic street for shoppers or strollers. 

The place was packed on a Friday night, but people weren't lining up outside...do make reservations if you just don't want to deal with a wait.

Recommended and will be back several times.
author: Nenette Y.

description: Bland, not exciting, nice decor and ambiance, but quality of fish was lacking. i was disappointed because of all the great ratings on here...
author: Cathy S.

description: This is probably my fave spot for sushi in the city.  Lunch and dinner are always great.  The staff are awesome, so friendly!  Nothing but love for this place!
author: Nathan J.

description: This place is nothing short of Mediocre. The service was really good, but the food is far from a 4 star restaurant.
author: Thiago S.

description: WOW!  Great fish, great rolls and great service.  Our server suggested some great nigiri based on stuff we told her we liked.  Top of my list of sushi in SF!
author: Max N.

description:
The perfect neighborhood japanese joint. Perfect for lunch, great for dinner...serves an awesome bowl of udon. A great alternative to the other sushi places in the neighborhood, which serve raw fish only.

They are also some of the nicest people ever...great service. I love the heated wash cloths they give you before you start eating.

Recommend:
- Udon: they serve a nice big bowl with three meat options
- Sushi: its good, fresh and consistent
- Tempura: the only joint in the neighborhood...and they do a great job with it
author: Rondeep C.

description:
Just another sushi joint. I didn't personally find it all that special, nothing stuck out as good nor did anything stick out as bad. But, there are times when sushi is heaven and times when it's average and this place was just average.

And, not overpriced? I spent $65 a person, had less sushi than I normally eat and no drinks so I guess people's definition of over priced is different than mine.
author: Gregg T.

description:
O-toro is pretty decent.  Reasonable fish selection and prices.  The seating is ample and lots of tables, so easy for groups.

Salmon belly in sauce was a highlight as was the negitoro roll.

Miso soup is not recommended.

A fine option, but I prefer Domo for casual sushi in Hayes Valley.
author: Aaron T.

description: Disclaimer: This is not a review of the entire restaurant. O-Toro is the only place in the area for emergency ramen situations. So if you are ever in an emergency ramen situation, and in Hayes Valley/ that side of Civic Center, O-Toro will serve that purpose. Yes, an emergency ramen situation is absolutely possible. Tasty on a cold day when you have such a need.
author: Niki M.

description: Excellent all around. Good vegetarian sushi (a rare veg caterpillar sushi!). Comprehensive sake collection (including flights). Phenomenal service.
author: A K.

description: Good sushi. If you are going to lunch,it fills up quickly so be prepared to sit at the bar.
author: Dee Dee H.

description: Service was terrible. Food was just okay. Sushi in SF is not that good compared to socal
author: James V.

description: As good as it gets. Super fresh. Melts in your mouth delectible!!!
author: Molly M.

description:
We go there a little late, due to finding a parking spot.  No prob, they held our table and got our water and drinks pretty fast.  We started with some Sashimi Maguro and Albacore, fresh and delicious.  

Then ventured to an assortment of different rolls such as the Salmon Avocado, Dreamy Sensation, and Hip Hop Roll.  Seriously?? Garlic on a sushi roll, actually a nice addition to the palate.  Great selection on their menu, but since we go there for sushi it would be great to have a few more rolls to choose from.

Tip: You may need to get the servers attention to get additional requests or to get the bill.  Plan ahead if you need to be somewhere after.
author: Chris M.

description: This is a small quaint place but don't b fooled by its size!  O toro sushi has a great selection of rolls and sashimi and if u think of one or craving something not on the menu just be prepared to custom order ur roll. How awesome is that!!!  I had the typical sea weed salad,  great no mushy and overly
author: Ryan M.

description:
Aight. Still not the dream sushi place I'm looking for. Will do the job though.

FYI - gets SUPER loud in here.
author: Sarah R.

description: Excellent, quality sushi.  So says me and 2 friends who are actually from Japan!  So I'd say it's legit.  The other food is good too, like the udon, but I think their forte is their fish.
author: Corey C.

description: Otoro is a hidden gem! It is small, but very modern and trendy. The staff is friendly and the service is great everytime. The fish is always fresh and of quality. I also love their pork jowl, garlic soft shell crab, and miso black cod. And to top it off with Bi-rite ice cream-yummy! This is my #1 place to go!
author: Crystal W.

description:
The sushi was good, but I was disappointed with the Japanese tapas.  I was expecting an experience similar to Furaibo in LA, but was not impressed with any of the non-sushi items.  The marinated fried chicken was particularly bad.  

The service was excellent, and the restaurant is small but cute.  I would go back for sushi.
author: Amy D.

description: The fish quality is great.  I always order from the board next to the sushi bar.  That is the good stuff.  Price is very reasonable too.  This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in SF and every time I bring a guest, they are very happy.
author: Chihiro F.

description:
a little gem in the heart of hayes valley, o-toro sushi offers fresh, creative, contemporary fare.

the beauty of o-toro is that it has a little bit of everything. it's kind of like a sushi bar, izakaya, ramen house and sake bar mixed into one. i've had a little bit of everything, and while it's all good, i usually stick to the sushi. 

as far as my favorites go, garlic is the name of the game. 

garlic soft shell crab + garlic albacore = LOVE

the garlic albacore is basically a nigiri of buttery melt-in-your-mouth white tuna topped with thinly sliced pieces of roasted garlic. delicious!

looking for something a little bit more substantial? try one of their special rolls. portions are fairly generous. since i love the garlic albacore, i tend to stick to the hip hop roll. it also tends to fit well with my lifestyle... HA. 

the yuzu flavored sake is also phenomenal. it packs quite the punch, and gives mike's hard lemonade a run for it's money. 

more good news, the take-out is just as good as dine-in!
author: Jessica S.

description: I had really bad experiences with Sushi restaurants in San Francisco, so i had a great surprise with this one. The classic maki rolls are amazing, especially the spicy tuna. And the fish is so fresh! The prices are a little bit high and the service not very fast. So it's better is you can take your time. I will definitely come back!
author: Emilie P.

description: I enjoyed the sushi here. I'd definitely recommend making reservations though as the place filled up quick, and there are not that many tables.
author: C S.

description: It was ok. The sushi was not as fresh as I hoped. The prices were a bit high for smaller sushi pieces. We had nice time. The ambiance and the mood of the place was relaxed.
author: Joan Z.

description: The food was great, but the service was so-so and coming from a small town my friends had no idea what to do with the warm towels that were given to us when we arrived I also found them unnessacary and our waitress offered us tea after we had already recieved our drinks and a little while before our food got to us.
author: Danielle J.

description: I have really liked this place in the past, but last week was disappointing.  The service was slow, and the fish tasted fishy and recently unfrozen.  The bill for omakase was also really high, which was annoying given that we didn't even enjoy the fish that much.
author: Jackie B.

description: A great local sushi place. Jimmy the owner clearly has high standards. Great and fresh fish.  And it's more than sushi. Great hot food.
author: brian p.

description: It's close to the SF conservatory if you happen to be in the hood before a concert, which I was.  Great bowl of ramen that was humongous and tasty and I liked the board of specials of the day.  They also kept my tea and water full which is key for me.  Well priced for a sushi bar!
author: Angie Y.

description: This place is a trusted neighborhood spot. The staff are always very friendly and accommodating, and the menu has a lot of unique and tasty options. The hip-hop roll is so yummy that I crave it regularly, and then I just have to figure out what else to get. Everything is always great. The space is really nice too. They heat the remians of my sake and bring it to me, such service! Pay special attention to the Japanese tapas, innovative and always so very delish. Impress someone, take them here!,
author: Isabel L.

description: I want to sing the praises of O-Toro. I was with a group of 10 people and O-Toro was fantastic.. they were friendly.... kept our drinks flowing... and offered quick service. The space is small and a bit loud when it fills up... but its a nice looking spot. The food is very good... both the sushi and the small plates.. everything we tasted was fantastic. The price point is also a winning point for O-Toro. Our dinner tab was quite reasonable for ten people eating sushi and drinking alcohol.
author: David C.

description: Decent Japanese food if you're too lazy to go Japantown. Limited menu though. But good nonetheless.
author: Jays D.

description:
O-Toro is hands down my favorite neighborhood sushi place. I know there are die hard Domo fans out there, but I think it's super overrated (and I gave it 3 different tries, and was unimpressed each time) in the Hayes Valley area. 

Otoro has great fresh sushi, and they also have a lot of other cooked options for those who aren't really feeling sushi. There's ramen, curry don and udon, as well as both hot and cold appetizers and specials. I always get the hamachi kama (it takes about 15 minutes to cook so I always order it the second I get seated before I get anything else), and the soft shelled crab (if they have it). it's a sushi restaurant, but their cooked food do not disappoint. If you're going for the sushi, I would strongly recommend the otoro roll (my favorite) and the golden state roll (my boyfriend's favorite). 

The restaurant itself is tiny and the turnover can be pretty slow, but grab some sake as you're waiting! The servers are great and attentive, and jimmy, the owner is the best guy. I think the ice cream he gives us on the house sometimes makes me a bit biased, but I love him. 

I've never been for lunch, but I hear that it's an awesome deal.
author: Lyn W.

description: Amazing dishes of modern Japanese cuisine as well the classics. Super fresh. Highly recommend it for especial occasions! And yes, the warm towels bring an extra cozy feeling!
author: Katarine Q.

description: Go to sushi place for lunch.  Eat there once per week.  Jimmy is ridiculously attentive to his customers, remembers our names, our regular orders, etc.  The lunch specials are a great deal, and they also have a wide range of rolls in terms of cost and variety.
author: Blair S.

description: Delicious ramen, fresh sushi, laidback vibe yet not boring, nice staff, very reasonable prices. I'm plotting my return! Thanks to Yelpers for introducing me to this off-the-beaten-path joint!
author: Sumi Y.

description:
We enjoyed a number of small plates, perfect for sharing with an intimate group. 

Try the specials. The spicy baked mussels were very tasty.  And the warm baked cod had a crunchy crust with a buttery middle.
author: Ryan M.

description: A little pricey, but very good fish. Overall a real good meal, but I just hate paying a lot for food when I'm hungry an hour later...then again I don't think I've ever eaten a sushi dinner that's sustained me for the whole night. Maybe it's me? Or is it you? No, it's probably me.
author: Ryan A.

description: takeout for 2 was ~$70 -- good quality but not enough to justify the premium.  quality sushi -- the ikura was truely special but they didn't give us the amaebi head and we got cut rolls even when we ordered handrolls.  The later likely an honest mistake.  I would consider going back to eat at the restaurant for dinner and would warn takeout guests to check the order before leaving the restaurant.
author: Ryan F.

description: Sushi is good but not amazing, but it's within the right price range. It is a very small restaurant, but the good thing is that they take reservation!
author: Kate J.

description:
It comes to no surprise that you might have to wait a bit for all the good things that Hayes Valley can offer. Otoro sushi is not one of them. 

It was truly a disappointing experience. 

We were told that a table for 2 would only take 15 minutes. They dragged it on for an hour. The couple before us--who even made a reservation--ended up leaving. Strike one.

I'll be honest, the food looked appetizing, so I still wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. At this point they realized that they royally f*cked up with their management of time. After profusely apologizing, they assured that our table would come up within the next 2 minutes. We were seated 8 minutes after.

It took another 30 minutes to get our rolls (small portions, btw). It was weird to see that our appetizer came last. Actually, it came 10 minutes after I mentioned it the second time. Who would have thought that it took half an hour to make vegetable tempura? Just admit that you forgot the order. Strike two. 

Strike three! Drunk obnoxious girl tips her drink off the table. I'm wet and there are shattered fragments on me. The waitress takes no lead in alleviating the situation, nor does the manager communicate with me in compensating for this inconvenience. The only concern was the liability of injury. Who cares that my jacket was wet or that shards cut into it?

It's unfortunate that we left nothing for tip. *Maybe except this: Your HUGE bathroom of one toilet + laundry extension can easily be cut in half. This will improve the use of space (+3 2-top capacity!) and your pathetic attempt in handling the flow of traffic. 

In conclusion, the service was "bleh" so it made the food "meh." 

For all the readers. I HEART SUSHI. TRUST.
author: Mark M.

description:
Really nice to have a local sushi spot (amongst many in the hood) that is totally cool with the casual walk-in take out styley.

I've been at this spot at least 7 times and everything I have tried has been consistently good.
author: Michael R.

description:
Ohhhh toro....oooooToRO.....oooooootoro....YUM!!! Plus a sake menu worth perusing....

If you aren't in the mood for otoro...just go for a quick donburi lunch...

Hey...I think it retains a sexy vibe left from the Cuban place that used to be here...but this is high gloss OOTORO....well hidden from the masses for now...! Sayonara Absinthe...such a wormwood place...Absinthedoesn't make any one's heart get fodder.
author: miriam b.

description: Awesome izakaya-style japanese tapas.  Will be back for sure.
author: Paul M.

description:
Good food but itty bitty portions for the price.

Had the following:

Seared Sake Belly - this was delicious! It was nigiri style and got two pieces for just under $6.

Chicken Skin - pretty good. Two pieces on skewers. Came with some sort of spice to dip in. It was like a spicy pepper blend. This was just under $6. 

Otoro Sushi Roll - tasty. This roll has mango on top. I forget what kind of fish was inside, I think tuna and yellowtail.  This was about $13.  It was a good roll, but was pretty small.

Happy with the food, but would either have to have an appetizer elsewhere or order more dishes here to get closer to feeling full.
author: Betty T.

description: Yummy, fresh sushi, reasonable prices... great neighborhood joint.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
My boyfriend and I randomly walked in here on Cinco de Mayo and were blown away. We usually eat Sushi in the Inner Richmond and the Mission the prices and quality of nigiri at Otoro was really oustanding. 

Do spring for the Otoro - pricey but unbeatable! Also didn't get to try the Hamachi Collar last time around-- I'll need to go back soon! 

Attentive service, excellent quality nigiri, cool ambiance. Casual date perfection.
author: julia k.

description: It was just OK! Nothing that warrants going back. Tiny place! Sat at sushi bar!!
author: Jimette R.

description: Love this place. Sit at the bar, get to know the owner and you'll get free sesame ice cream for life!
author: Eric K.

description: Pretty good place for fresh sushi... we made a reservation on a Wednesday night and glad we did; it was packed (its a small place too; fits only ~20-25 guests).  There was only 2 wait staff, but they did a great job managing the needs of all the tables.  The fish was fresh, prices were standard ($12-13 for specialty rolls, $4-5 per 2-piece sashimi order) and the restaurant was romantic and dark.  I loved the garlic albacore (amazing!) roll.  I still liked the rolls at Sushi Aka Tombo slightly better, but this place is definitely a local place I'd go back to.
author: Grace M.

description: My family was in town so I took them to O-Toro based on Yelp reviews. We were thoroughly disappointed. They seated us quickly but the quality of the sushi was sub-par. The tapas were decent but I will not be coming here again.
author: Christine H.

description: mmm, Otoro.  Came here before the symphony and had delicious vegetarian sushi.  The servers were friendly and accommodating.  The restaurant itself is very small (reservations strongly recommended) - it was tastefully decorated and modern which created a lovely ambiance.  We arrived a bit late and had to rush our meal but the service was prompt and the rolls were delicious. Parking can be a bit challenging and the restaurant is a little hidden but it is certainly worth it. We'll definitely be returning the next time we're in the area!
author: H T.

description:
great: sashimi

ok: sushi rolls

not so good: unagi nigiri (so sweet..... far from what we are used to), seaweed salad. (also too sweet)

the service is good, not too slow either on a seemingly pretty busy night. price is fair, but maybe slightly higher than average.
author: Danielle A.

description: Otoro has become my new favorite spot.  Cute little sushi place nestled in Hayes Valley.  Everything ive had has always been extremely fresh.  From the hamachi to the maguro to the tako...its all delicious, and the tako was some of the best ive had.  The soft shell crab hit the spot and was fried to perfection.   They also offer hot & cold japanese tapas style plates - very good if you feel like having a light meal.  Everything is more than reasonably priced and the staff are very friendly.  Sit at the bar and let the chef serve you up some of his specialties.  He's awesome.
author: Juv C.

description: Charming Hayes Valley neighborhood sushi/Japanese restaurant.  Staff is very friendly.  The highlight of the place is their sake selection.  While the sushi is not top of the market, it's nice to go to a place at times where you can get a combination of decent fish and robata food.
author: Laurence H.

description: We feel so lucky to live in the same block as this place, it's super yummy, and the people are so nice. It's the best.
author: Martha Sue H.

description: Omg awesome fresh fish and everything else was just excellent quality. We tried three different unfiltered sakes and they were all great. Our waitress was so helpful and we were very happy with the food. We ordered almost half the menu for four people !
author: Mickey Z.

description: Pleasant vibe, decent seating space and friendly staff. A great sushi option in Hayes Valley since Domo and Sebo are much more expensive and Domo is hard to get into since it's so tiny. I haven't tried everything yet, but the braised black cod is one of my favorites--melt in your mouth deliciousness.
author: Sandra P.

description: I love this spot. I made reservations and was seated within 10 minutes even though this under 30 seated spot was PACKED. The service was very kind and the food was brought in a timely manner. We had about 13 different rolls to share between 4. My favorite was the spicy tuna, philidelphia and spider roll. The bill was surprisingly very low for all the food we got. From the looks of this place you'd think it's a bit pricey. The best thing of all, I didn't feel that "overly full" feel after wards even though I ate a lot! Will go again.
author: Ozzy A.

description: Fun, romantic, hip vibe...very, very high quality sushi - especially good butterfish. Delectable deserts, and a great sake menu. I didn't proactively order a thing - I was just drinking and eating everything that was pushed towards me. It was all delicious.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Looking for a new sushi spot around my area to take my mom, I decided to go to Otoro Sushi after reading some of the rave reviews on Yelp. 

It was 7pm last night - a Friday - and the place had only 2 customers. But we didn't let that dissuade us from trying the place out; after all, this might just be the one of those 'hidden gems'.

We ordered the Cherry Blossom Roll, Dragon Roll and Miso Ramen Noodle Soup. The rolls came out first and both were good. However, the ramen took some time to arrive. It wasn't anything special but I now know better than to order ramen at a sushi place.

So why the 1 star?

And why is this my first Yelp review ever?

At 4 am this morning, I wake up with one of the worst stomach aches in my life. My mother calls me at around 9 am complaining of stomach pains and told me that she woke up in the middle of night vomiting. 

And so I ask, how fresh are their fish really? 

I'm never going here again.
author: Regina A.

description: This place was a very pleasant surpise! The specials were delicious and unique.  We ordered asparagus wrapped in Kobe beef, salmon stuffed mushrooms, and two rolls - tempura pumpkin with garlic albacore and spicy tuna with mango! Delicious! Vegan chocolate coconut bi rite ice cream topped it all off. I will definitely be back!
author: Denise K.

description: Decent little whole in the wall sushi place with an upgraded atmosphere, but also a slight upgrade in usual sushi price... which multiplies when eaten by the piece. Not satisfactory American sized portions/price, one of those two things needs two change. You either leave hungry or slightly overspent, not a good feeling. But I had a good time.
author: Jean P.

description: I went here the other night with a group of friends.  The ambiance and decor is really great here.  I got there before the rest of my crew and they were very slow to even get me a drink before the rest of my crew arrived.  :(  The sashimi and the rolls are definitely good, but not super-duper-fantastic.  I really enjoyed my sake as well.  The agedashi tofu was sub-par: the tofu needed to be crispier.  I left feeling good and satiated, but not glowing.
author: Diane D.

description: O'toro has it all - great sushi, great price, great restaurant, great service, and convenient location (for ppl living in hayes valley).
author: Shirley Z.

description:
My friends and I decided to give this new Sushi joint a try. 
Having been to Japan, I have become a sashimi snob. 
Otoro Sushi does not dissappoint. The sashimi was fresh and uber tasty. I also indulged in some of there sushi rolls which were also great especially their signature roll the "Otoro Roll" (spicy tuna with slice of mango). Can't wait to go back and try some of their ramen and udon =P
author: Quang W.

description: You gotta like sushi. Just a phenomenal restaurant.
author: Alena L.

description:
dinner with the hubby on a Saturday night ~7:30.  parking was terrible (should expect nothing less in this part of town).  1st time here, we were seated at a table almost immediately.  looked like there are only 2 servers working the entire room (seat, serve, bus).  

food: came looking for izakaya in particular, and enjoyed the hot tapas.  also ordered some nigiri sushi to try some specials, and although it all tasted fresh, the guy that sliced our fish was not a sushi chef (shame on the chef for letting our order go out without his direct supervision).

so why the low rating?  it took an hour from the time we ordered to get our first hot plate.  the servers kept saying "your food is coming" -- yes, but WHEN is it coming?!  no explanation for why the wait or how much longer the wait.  [what happened??? or is this normal?]

i noticed everyone at the bar got their food fairly quick (sushi orders), while tables had to wait.  this is particularly aggravating when you're sitting there starving...

i wouldn't have minded the long wait as much had they let me know right after i ordered that the kitchen is a bit slow...then thrown in some free edamame / drinks / bread / ANYTHING that i could shove in my mouth while waiting for an hour.

the food has potential, but no hurry to return due to service.
author: S R.

description: Bold, bold combinations, friendly staff and simple but cozy atmosphere.  The sushi is the perfect size to fit in your mouth as well, so that you don't have to wrestle with it.  I ordered a Takashi roll with pumpkin, tuna and garlic--surprisingly colorful and nutty, sweet and savory.  AND they have Bi-Rite ice cream for dessert!  (I had the gingerbread.)  Thanks much to Mike and Colleen for introducing me to this spot.  :)
author: Jo S.

description: Lovely little sushi place, close to home so we eat here often. Their noodles are tasty and great on a chilly day.  It feels a tad bit expensive, but hey, it's sushi! The rolls I've tried have all been solid, and the fish has always been fresh.
author: Alexandra L.

description: This place is awesome. I had tuna, halibut, butter fish, and eel, a shrimp tempura roll, and a red bean mochi dessert. It was all fantastic, and I'm a bit of a sushi snob.
author: Stephanie G.

description: The sushi here is sublime. So flavorful and well cut. We ordered the spicy tuna roll, a specialty roll with tuna & crab, yellowtail sushi and uni sushi. All of it was delicious. For starter we got the garden salad and agadashi tofu.  It's not a huge space, so you may have to wait if you don't make reservations.  Pricing is moderate, especially considering the quality.
author: Ka C.

description: Eh. Not bad, but not great either. Thumbs up for the spicy tofu salad, but the rolls were just...eh. However, they did have one of my favorite milky sakes so I was happy just to be there enjoying the company of my friends.
author: Susie D.

description:
Sush friendly staff....  you can not hate them...  there is no way. So sensible...   

But...  I reget I wasn't honest about my opinion..I just didn't know how nicely to tell thm.

Sabaa isn't cured right....  their kitchen items.. little. On the salty side without rice....  

Love them when it comes to people.. but sushi, sorry but no.
author: E P.

description: Stopped in here for lunch with a co-worker base don the reviews and was decently impressed. We had the rainbow roll and the golden state roll wit some miso and tea. Just a light lunch. The rolls are not very large so one person could realistically eat two rolls to themselves and not feel like a water buffalo. Fish was fresh which is always key, and the flavor of the rolls was quite good. Rice wasn't too heavy either. Miso was perfect imo, not too salty but nice and piping hot. The don't dye their ginger( yey) but the wasabi had more of the horseradish paste taste than actual wasabi :( (boo). The service was attentive but not overbearing. Took a little long to get our check once we finished but that being said it came promptly once we flagged someone down to request it.  We also weren't told about any of the specials or different items not on the menu which was a bummer : / We didn't notice the board listing these items either right away as a person was sitting at the bar in front of it. Was good for a last minute impromptu lunch, but not a place I would say I'd journey back into the city for. Def one of those stop by if I am in the area types.
author: Meg N.

description:
i might have a slight bias w/ this review.  i went about 5:30 on a wednesday and was the only one in there.  jimmy from the wait staff was very nice and friendly and sat me at bar.  maki-san at the sushi bar greeted me and i was off to a dinner of some incredibly great fish with some warm company.

sitting at the sushi bar i asked maki-san that i was going omakase.  what he presented was beautiful to look at and taste.  he started me off w/ live scallops in the shell and followed that w/ a myriad of nigiri.  everything given was incredible:

-himare (fluke)
-aji (spanish mackerel)
-masu (sea trout)
-salmon belly
-walu (butterfish, raw and slightly seared)
-giant clam
-amberjack
-surprise rolls

he made two rolls w/ engawa (the fatty fin of a fluke/halibut).  one with uni (sea urchin) and the other with ankimo (monkfish liver).  these rolls were a great way to end the meal.  the engawa had a nice richness to it and both the uni and the ankimo complimented that in their own way.  

my other favorites were the seared walu, the giant clam and the salmon belly.  not to say the others weren't great it was just that these were just a notch above the rest.

i also got the sake flight and liked 2 of the 3 but i don't remember the names.  jimmy also gave me a special lychee mojito which was very refreshing.

overall, this was a great experience and i would go back in a heart beat!
author: Swarup B.

description: the walu was out of this world.  the service aimed to please.   little loud and smoky hence the 4 star rating.  but will be back!
author: maia j.

description: Great sushi, and also the first time I've ever ordered the same roll twice in one dinner. They served drinks while we waited, and worked to get us seated as fast as they could. I'd go back any day.
author: Peter J.

description: Good food, and I enjoyed having something other than just the same-old on the menu (Japanese Tapas). Prices are reasonable too, despite the decor being more contemporary and nice. Plenty of people. I'm no big fan of the 'arigato' brigade (not into sushi because I want to pretend to be Japanese) but the night was still well spent here.
author: KW I.

description: I went back a few weeks ago, and the food is still good BUT their prices went up. They charged me 13 dollars for a special vegetable roll - not cool!
author: Harvinder K.

description: Went there on their second night open apparently.  The place looks a lot better than the former cuban restaurant that was there.  The fish was fresh and the sushi chefs were personable.  The prices were very reasonable and the sushi was well done.  We didn't get any of the "fancy rolls" as I prefer simple sushi with fresh fish.  The rolls were well done.  The negi hamachi and spicy tuna rolls were good.  The salmon skin roll needed some work, but it's rarely done well.  Had the albacore, hamachi and amberjack, all of which were good.  The sushi chefs gave us a sample of the sake belly, which was really good and something I hadn't had before.  It seems like a great neighborhood spot that you can keep going back to.
author: Brian Y.

description: Love this place. The Ramen is wonderful, sushi is great too! The good service keeps me coming back!
author: Drew D.

description: A friend and I came here for dinner last week, and while the sushi was amazing, it got a little awkward towards the end of the evening, as we felt like we were being rushed out of the place. True, it was approaching closing time, but we'd ordered plenty of sake and sushi, including delicious Toro. And when the waitress had told us it was last call, my friend had ordered some ramen, but then he was in essence, rushed to finish it. So yes, Otoro comes highly recommended by a girl friend, the mood lighting was fab, and the fish was fantastic, but I felt a little more rushed than relaxed towards the end of our evening. And it wasn't the vibe we wanted.
author: Sally M.

description:
so not worth it: long wait, careless staff (worst service i've had in a while), overpriced, flavorless fish (thank god it comes in tiny cuts!), and the worst eggplant i've ever had - do you know how to cook eggplant? cause otoro doesn't. 

this place's main saving grace is the noodle soup - delicious - and only reason for the third star. i repeat, do not come here for the sushi. i don't know what everyone else on yelp has been smoking, but it's killing your taste buds!
author: alina p.

description: This place just opened across the street from where I live. So of course i have to check it out. The ambience is nice. New, modern, clean. Its a small  place. The sushi is ok and a little overpriced but I will eat there again because its convenient.
author: Caroliina F.

description: I came here with a good friend of mine after a meet n' greet event.  Needless to say it was very, very good.  And even though it is located in a place where I do not generally go, I would come back just to enjoy O-Toro again.  The sushi was fresh and the price was right.  I ordered two rolls and my total was still only about $12.  The tea was complimentary, just ask.  The rolls aren't too heavily padded with rice, which means more fish.  Yay!  I had the Unagi-cucumber and a salmon roll.  The Unagi-cucumber was so good and warm and filling I almost couldn't handle it.  As per usual, I had a salmon roll.  It was nothing fancy, but it was still really good.  The service was fairly fast, but the waitress asked everyone who walked in if they had a reservation, which I thought was weird.  Oh, well.  I was impressed overall.  And I will definitely be coming to O-Toro again.
author: Hanah C.

description: Thought I would give Otoro a try.  It looked like a quality sushi joint in my favorite Hayes Valley.  Yes, the quality was probably more like 3-4 stars, but everything else was 2 stars.  The most memorable part of the meal (and memorable not in a good way) was that the staff sat us in a table that was so blocked and cramped, we had to literally ask the couple sitting next to us to get up and move their table and chairs, so we could get out of our dining space and leave!!  In other words, the restaurant is super cramped and the placement of tables is way off.  Overall, I would not go back, and I miss my Sushi Bistro!!
author: Kelly A.

description:
We ate here for the first time on Saturday.  We found the fish fresh..the dumplings delicious and the rolls affordable.  Others have mentioned that this place was expensive..but I don't often see rolls for less than $15..and some of their rolls were priced at $12...but TONS were less than $10.  For the caliber and quality...we all felt (in our group of 5) that this place was spot on and reasonable.  

Also..and this is a major point..they were willing to make all their rolls with brown rice instead of white.  Huge selling point for our crew.  Thumbs up on this place.  We'll be back.
author: Sarah S.

description: A bartender at Paul K had recommended this place for Japanese.  It was a good rec.  The only issue I had was we had to wait 20 minutes even though we had a reservation and there was a pretty lengthy amount of time in between the edamame and the sushi.  But the sushi was good enough that I forgave them for the delay.  :-)
author: S W.

description: Wow- my new fave sushi stop on SF.  Move over Sebo and Sushi Groove!
author: Kurt F.

description: This is our neighborhood place, and we love it.  The sushi is fresh and always tasty and well prepared.  If you are not in the mood for fish, the vegetarian rolls are also great (my personal crack is the vegetarian caterpillar roll.  Yum).  The decor is sleek but not pretentiously so.  The staff is always very nice and helpful.  And Jimmy, the owner, is great.  They even named a roll after my husband (the "Adam Roll" - it's good, you should try it).  Definitely one of the best sushi places we have tried in SF.
author: Leah A.

description: Otoro Sushi was by far and away the best dining experience we had during our visit to San Francisco!  We made our reservation through open table and gave ourselves thirty minutes to get there but couldn't find parking and found we were running late.  Called the restaurant to let them know we were running late and they were very understanding.  Fifteen minutes later, we arrived to a very full Otoro Sushi restaurant and several people waiting to be seated.  However, we were very pleased (and grateful) to find they had held our table for us and seated us immediately upon our arrival!!!  Wow, outstanding service!  They raised the bar even higher when we tasted the food; edamame, tempura shrimp and vegies, dragon and spider sushi rolls, were all delicious!  The service was very prompt and courteous allowing us plenty of time to walk to the symphony. Highly recommend Otoro Sushi and we will definitely make a point to dine there during our next visit to San Francisco!
author: Jesse C.

description: Great little sushi place, discovered on Yelp when thinking how to diversify the usual pre-ballet-symphony-opera dinner places. Good decision - quality sushi, nice environment and no long wait and stress of not making the show on time. Will be back.
author: P I.

description: Good sushi. Maybe a bit on the pricey side, but worth it if you're craving sushi. The toro was excellent. The specialty rolls are good, if a bit expensive. Overall, thumbs up.
author: Dana L.

description:
Had a great experience at this place with some friends in from Marin. The sushi was amazingly fresh and delicious. We tried a few of the specials and some of the rolls. The Otoro Roll (with mango) was a favorite (we ordered seconds!) as well as some of the seared nigiri. YUM.

The food was a bit slow coming out, the the service was very pleasant--the owner seems very nice and cares about his customers. 

I just might make it my new neighborhood sushi joint.
author: Lauren Q.

description: Came here last night with a group of 4 and we tried a number of dishes.  All the cooked food was really good.  Notable mentions are the sake kama, chicken wings, yakitori and braised butterfish.  For the most part, the dishes were not only delicious but also very easy on the wallet.  And now for the bad: the sushi.  The ingredients were fresh but the sushi rice was frankly, quite terrible.  It was slightly undercooked and lacked the requisite vinegar taste.  In addition, the nori in the rolls were very soggy when they arrived at our table, which is not how they are supposed to be.  So 4 stars for the cooked food but 3 stars for the sushi and a half-star deduction for how slow the food came out.
author: Sandy W.

description:
I have never written a review but I felt compelled.

Otoro is the best Sushi I have had taking price into consideration period. I cooked in a Japanese restaurant for 2 years and made sushi for 1 I am no expert but I know know enough to get by.

There may be better sushi but not for the price. 

Chef Maki has excellent technique, a great presence, and his food is awesome. 


We tried a ton of stuff but the two best were 
1. 2 piece garlic albacore nigiri 
2. 2 piece mackerel nigiri. 

I would say that the mackerel may have been the best piece of sushi I have ever had. He tucks in a small piece of fresh kelp which makes for an amazing taste. If you have never had mackerel or don't like it, try it here. Saba is stronger than most fish so keep that in mind.

They have amberjack and albacore which are more sustainable fish than most other fish which are high on the food chain like maguro and most hamachi. This is not the case for most places in the city. 

One more reason to go is the variety of Japanese style hot dishes which are much more sophisticated than the typical fare at sushi joints.

The homemade gyoza were very tasty. 99% of places use frozen gyoza and charge the same price. 

We had gyoza, two miso soup, two rolls, 4 two piece nigiri, 2 hot sake, and two large Kirins, for around $65.00. I left buzzed and full. 

Go here. Try the more interesting stuff. A spicy tuna is a spicy tuna. Try something which demonstrates chef Maki's creativity.
author: mac w.

description:
Truly, this is a 3.5 star rating.
I went yesterday for lunch on a whim.  I didn't know they were there, and open for lunch.  An old colleague and I were lunching, and instead of walking up to Hayes, we went here.  As we walked in I noticed the music was playing (not too loud, but loud enough to enjoy the 80's tunes they were playin), and the place was empty.  We sat down, and looked at the menu.  One great thing, they were very reasonable priced.  The sushi looked fresh, and my friend was into the bento box more than the sushi, yet I wanted to try both.  We order a spider roll, and 2 bento boxes.  Her's was with beef teriyaki ($8.95) and mine was chicken teriyaki ($7.95), both came with miso soup, rice, and a great salad.  The presentation was nice, and not served in those funky square boxes that most places serve the bento's in.  It was on a nice white plate, and presented well.  The spider roll was ok, and just ok.  It totally fell apart when we tried to eat the pieces, which was 5 for ($8.95), not too bad.  I would have skipped that though because it was a mess!  Not good.  The taste after trying to manage a bite, again was ok.  So I am not sure about the sushi, as that was the only roll we had.  
The bento was cheap and easy, and if I am craving one, I will try the take out version.  I will, however, try the sushi again, just to be sure it wasn't an "off" day for the suchi chef.  
All in all, ok.  Cute place, very clean.  Will give it another go.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Just bumped into this cute neighborhood restaurant that just opened.   Enjoyed a bowl of tasty ramen.   Great ambiance, and reasonably priced.   Looking forward to trying more of their menu next time!
author: Aaron C.

description: high quality with a wide selection of usual and unusual items.
author: Jim M.

description: One of the best I've had! Fresh fish, friendly service, fun area, good prices. The Hip Hop roll changed my life!!! I'm going to be craving that for a while! The atmosphere is great, a little small, but nice. Make reservations for busy nights.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Really nice place and great service. The Shoyu ramen -- so delicious. I never knew ramen could be so good! My neighborhood had no sushi restaurants for soooo long, and now we have THREE. They're all good, but this one is my favorite.
author: Dana D.

description: Service was terribly slow for us, but the food was good, though still overpriced in my opinion considering the portions.  I prefer Domo which is just a few blocks down.
author: Diana C.

description: This has quickly become our favorite neighborhood spot to get sushi. Even if you have relatively unrefined tastes like me, you can tell this sushi is fresher and tastier than the norm. Some of our favorites include the Walu (Butterfish), Cherry Blossom, and Krabby, usually accompanied by some edamame and green tea. Service has always been speedy and friendly, and prices are decent. We've been several times and never walked out disappointed.
author: Dave W.

description: Great experience.  The sushi was awesome.  A couple of their appetizer dishes left a little to be desired, but perhaps they're still just getting their legs.  The service was fabulous!  Their sake selection is great.  I will most definitely go back.  Perhaps even tonight....
author: Kerry L.

description: This is a small restaurant on one of the busy street in SF.  The staff is very friendly and it's pretty clean.  This is our first time going to this restaurant and the sushi is fresh.   It's ok overall.  Will go again.
author: dek c.

description: Oh yum!  We went last Sunday and this place is just great.  Everything is super fresh, super tasty.  Great, simple menu (simple as in not over complicated, but there are plenty of options).  Friendly staff and owner.  Small, cute, intimate and surprisingly good music selection! Just super.  A wonderful sushi/japanese food find!  Street parking works well enough in this part of Hayes Valley too.  We'll be back!
author: Isa L.

description: Great sushi.  I like my Japanese food clean tasting and beautifully presented.  O-Toro fits the bill.  We recommend trying the specials, which were all excellent the last time we ate here.  The spinach and seaweed salads are also much fresher than most Japanese sushi restaurants we have visited.  The space is close, but our table was comfortable enough.
author: Suzanne M.

description:
I give two stars because of the atmosphere.  Sushi was superb, actually.  Unfortunately the quality of food was highly contradicted by the unprofessionalism on the floor.  Our waiter (who we subsequently learned was the owner) REEKED of cigarette smoke, namely because of the numerous smoking breaks we watched him take when we were looking to order.  Disgusting!  Nothing ruins the flavor of sushi more than the putrid smell of cigarette smoke.  We also noticed that the level of his service was directly correlated with his level of sobriety.  He was noticeably drinking, and his service was noticeably suffering.  But the real capper came suddenly when we heard him screaming about something in the kitchen, and then he came out on the floor and  started literally yelling at his chefs "DON'T FUCK WITH ME!" in the middle of the floor.   It was unbelievable!  An owner trying to provoke his chefs into a fight in the middle of the restaurant?!  Just when you think you've seen it all, right?   I thought I was going to witness his beheading, but the chefs are apparently used to this, as they just ignored his drunken rant until he finally went outside to smoke (again).   It was so embarrassing and childish that the whole restaurant was snickering at him.  I almost felt sorry for him as he sulked outside with his cigarette.  
     Talk about an uncomfortable dining experience!  I also think I was overcharged for a couple items, but at that point I simply wanted to pay and leave, and not look back!  Kudos to the chefs for their professionalism and restraint in the face of drunken idiocy.  I wonder if they kicked the shit out of him at the end of the night.  Unfortunately, I will not be able to ask  them in person as I will definitely not be going back!  I hope they did though!
author: Gofah K.

description: I had no expectations when coming here but found one of the best sushi places in San Francisco. The staff was friendly but not the fake kind of friendly. The food was well presented and tasted good. I had the hawaiian poki salad and shoyu ramen and both were delicious.
author: Vien T.

description:
A pretty nice and cozy sushi restaurant tucked away in Hayes Valley. I came here a couple weeks ago with some of my fellow coworkers for dinner. 

We made reservations via phone and walked in around dinner time w/ no problems. Immediately sat down and debated for a good 20 minutes of what dishes to share. 

The sushi here is definitely top notched. We ordered at least 7 different types of rolls, which were all laid out in a very unique pattern. The service was also great. We accidentally stayed a good 20-30 min after we paid talking and our server kept pouring us more tea w/o any attitude. 

Overall, great place and highly recommend for any sushi addicts.

tl;dr: 1 star for the presentation, 2 for the fresh sushi, 1 for great service, -1 for price (somewhat on the pricey side).
author: Danny N.

description:
Can I give Otoro Sushi with 6 stars rating?!!!

The sashimi was excellent, and the oysters were fresh and had a light sweet taste to it....  

the rolls were made delicately, the flavors were just right............   i will definitely be a regular!!!
author: Anders C.

description: This fantastic new eatery is off the main drag of Hayes Valley, so you have to be willing to walk out of your way some what to find it. And, once you do, you'll likely agree that it's a welcome new addition for any one who loves Japanese cuisine. Delicious special sushi rolls, well-made hot food entrees (featuring short ribs and mackerel, among others), and sake, sake, sake make this a must-try night out for foodies. Very nice sized portions that are great for sharing among friends, and the small bistro feel makes this an excellent addition to a neighborhood already full of great places to eat. Typical pricing is about $30-$40 per person, but it's well worth your time and attention, and never a bad thing to spend your hard earned dollars on a new enterprise!
author: Marc S.

description:
i've never been to the restaurant before Otoro but i'm glad Otoro is in the neighborhood. their sushi is fresh and delicious. i have to come back to try the rolls! 

dinner:
toro nigiri 
sake nigiri 
unagi nigiri 
amaebi [including fried shrimp heads] 
salmon belly 
miso ramen 
house sake [hot/large]

total: $50 + tip. 

here's the review:

service: friendly and nice. they are good at refilling your water and tea and asking how everything is but not so good at clearing your plate [at the bar]. i think it's bc it was busy and they are still getting into the groove of things. 

food: i was happy they had amaebi [raw  sweet shrimp] - so good. it was my first time having toro so i didn't have anything to compare to. but through past sushi experiences, it was super fresh and melts in your mouth. the sake [salmon] was delicious too flavorful and softest i ever had. the ramen was huge with everything [pork, seaweed, corn, bean sprouts, spinach, bamboo]. 

*the presentation of the food is beautiful. 

atmosphere: i like the small sushi bars; they are intimate. sitting at the bar is always fun bc you get to socialize with the chef and see what other customers are getting and get recommendations. 

drink: the house sake was ok. it was cheap; what can i say. the tea was sub-par. it was as flavorful and the aroma wasn't as the same as Domo [their green tea + brown rice is really really good].  

chef: the sushi chef is AWESOME and entertaining. 

price: fairly reasonable. if you watch your pocket, you can get away with spending about $25-30 per person. however, you can easily spend $50-65 per person. *note, this is for sushi. 

sure you can come in and order a bowl of udon and tea and walk away spending about $12-15 but what's the point?! SUSHI is a must.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: This is the best local sushi place I've been to in ages. Everything has been fresh and savory every time we been and this place is one of the few that still presents the traditional cloth for washing up before the meal, which I feel is a real plus. The restaurant is small and intimate, but I've never felt crowded there. It can be casual or dressy (sometimes patrons come by after the opera) so feel free to go either way. The staff is friendly and courteous and they have time to chat a bit and answer general questions. I do not feel they are overly priced for the top quality food we've had there. We enjoyed every bite!
author: Lia H.

description: Great sushi and sake. The ambiance is not much, but the place has fantastic tasting sushi with great design. I would recommend, great wait staff as well.
author: Kim K.

description:
I love Sushi. No really - I love it. 

Otoro is a new joint down the street from my home. I was skeptical but decided to try something new. I was glad I did. The restaurant itself was really beautifully decorated. It's a calm and clean decor. 
The entire staff is really friendly. 
Service: Fantastic and friendly. We even got to meet the owner who was warm and welcoming, drank with his guests but wasn't overbearing and didn't make you feel uncomfortable. The Sushi Chef was funny and nice. Very generous with his portions and really tried to create a fun atmosphere. 
Fish Quality:  I had Aji, Wallu, Mackeral and seared Halibut. All of them were tasty and fresh - however I was a bit disappointed with the garnish and wasabi on each. I know I know, it's common for some places to use wasabi but I just like my fish on rice with nothing on it. 
Rolls: They let you modify and create your own rolls!!! - Too cool. I had a Lava roll (Tempura shrimp with cucumbers, avocado and green onions), but subbed out half the Tuna (on top) for Hamachi - sooo tasty.
My only gripes are with the Spicy Tuna Handroll and the Hawaiian roll - too much mayo. Again, I like to taste my fish. 
Entrees: We had the Black Cod - holy crap. so. fuckin. good.
Execution: Very skillful chef. 
The prices were a little on the high end, but the portions are generous. 

Everything, despite the mayo snafus, was great. Typically I can't deal with mayo but the level of execution and the warmth of the staff was fantastic and something I look forward to experiencing again and again. 

I plan on being semi-regular and hope you will too.  :)
author: Liliana A.

description:
I was pretty happy when Domo moved into the neighborhood but I am even happier about Otoro. The only somewhat downside of this place is that it is pretty small, maybe slightly bigger than Domo, but other than that everything else rocks.

The sushi is not too expensive but it's seriously one of the best I have had in SF. The menu has a lot of variety and best of all, there is a ton of izakaya items on there too. Mostly everything is decently priced, very good, and the service is also very friendly and quick. 

I want this place to get popular so it stays around, but not so popular that I can't even get a table. 

One request: PLEASE make the chirashi bowl available for dinner, please.
author: pankaj l.

description: I enjoy going to Otoro for lunch.  Their food tastes wonderfully fresh and there are an adequate number of vegetarian dishes.  The salads are actually pretty large, and my eyes are usually bigger than my stomach, so I end up more full than I'd planned.  But it's all so good for me, I'm sure it doesn't matter.
author: Polly M.

description: this place is the worst. we ordered extra ginger and eek sauce and they charged us $10. sushi is mediocre (nothing above average) like any normal sushi place. service is not good. we came in with a party of 5 and they sat us at a table of 4 and tried to squeeze 3 people on a side of the table tht clearly made for max 2 people. there was no room to move our arms. they got our order wrong and mischarged us. anyways, food is meh service is bad. never coming back
author: Ida Z.

description: The seared hamachi belly is amazing! The service is great. The food is always delicious.
author: Rachel T.

description: Thank goodness for new sushi spots that are off the beaten path. Fresh and reasonably priced sushi. Staff aimed to please. Trendy interior and cool music - down tempo beats. Only drawback was the acoustics. Abnormally high level of noise from people's voices for such a small place. However, the quality of the food and excellent service overpowered the noise.
author: M E.

description: What a nice place.  My husband and I came to dinner at this little restaurant and really enjoyed our meal.  The service was prompt and polite and the food was very fresh.  We sampled their saki flight which was delightful.  We'd like to go back to this little restaurant when we're in the mood for sushi.
author: Denny L.

description: This is now my favorite sushi place in the city. Make sure to sit at the bar and ask for the daily specials.
author: Louis P.

description:
Otoro is one of our favorite sushi places. They have tasty and inventive food that is artfully presented. The ambiance is intimate and casual.  

In addition to the fresh fish, ankimo, and live scallop, we've also had the freshest, most delicious uni ever here.  

Jimmy often surprises us with something new and interesting.
author: A. B.

description: I'm a total fan!! I love going to here for Friday lunches....or dinners or whenever I can make it. I rarely go a week without having a meal at Otoro. Do yourself a favor and try the krabby roll if you haven't already. It's a very reasonably priced specialty roll and is super delicious!!
author: Makela C.

description: We having been coming to O-Toro Sushi weekly since they opened and the sushi and service are always top-notch.  The quality is both extremely high and entirely consistent.  We've compared with many other SF sushi restaurants and feel that O-Toro is well above the competition.  Whether ordering to-go or at the restaurant, you will be treated well by Jimmy and I bet you'll find yourself returning again and again as we have.
author: Larry B.

description: I really love that Otoro is small and intimate. The staff was very pleasant and the food came quickly. Everything was fresh and delicious. All in all I enjoyed the meal and would come back if I was in the area.
author: Erin D.

description: A great addition to the neighborhood. The other sushi joint is great but this is just what Hayes Valley needs. An excellent sushi house. Fresh fish, great service and location. The toro was awesome- oh so buttery! Better thant any of the chain sushi joints - not quite Sebo but you will save some cash. I really enjoyed it and wil go back! FYI - I ilike nigiri and sashimi - that's all I had and it was excellent.
author: Ricardo L.

description:
Went to Otoro the other night (Sunday) when everything else was closed. Not our first (or second) choice but happily surprised!

We went for a light snack/dinner just a few rolls and conversation. The atmosphere is delightful with funky music and friendly service.

The Golden Gate roll was my personal favorite, though the spicy tuna was a close second. Definitely will be back here.

Price: $53 for 2 people
5 Rolls and Edamame with water and green tea.
author: J o.

description: It really is from start to finish one of the best dining experiances I have ever had. Thank you guys for actually know what repeat business is and having AMAZING food. I have now spent two birthdays, an anniversary, christmas eve, and about five friends from out of town...type dinners here....went again last night (anouther birthday)...and all I want to do is go againg tonight.
author: Ray J.

description: I really liked the sushi here, it was nice and fresh. I loved the humor of the sushi chief and how they kept my glass full with beer all night. I highly recommend sitting at the bar to get the full experiance of being at a sushi restaurant.
author: Mario O.

description: came here for lunch with the sister and left happy.  my sis is a regular here so the waitstaff was super friendly and attentive.  sushi was fresh and at decent prices.  definitely a must try if you're in hayes valley and craving some japanese.
author: Helen T.

description: delicious! yes the salmon is as amazing as others have reported. can't believe I've never been here before.
author: Karen N.

description:
went for lunch and had a very satisfying experience.
short ribs and miso mackerel were great. not insanely amazing, but enough to be full and happy and still able to go back to work (as in, i feel energized after that meal as opposed to uncomfortably full). service was pleasant. my tea was never empty, and the owner was always smiling.
lunch special also comes with miso soup, a salad, and rice. throw in a side of california rolls (just needed something to munch on before the food got to the table), and with tax and tip the meal ended up being ~30 for 2. not bad, not the best deal i've ever had, but i would definitely go back again.
author: Lia A.

description: Loved the variety of vegetarian rolls here.  The gold flight of sake was fantastic!  Best I've ever had!  Make a reservation, or you will probably have to wait.
author: Rachael S.

description: new & modern. very reasonably priced. good quality for the price.
author: Yevi A.

description: Excellent food, great ambiance, good service. Highly recommended.
author: Anna R.

description: "The perfect neighborhood Japanese joint" referenced by Rondeep... yes that sums it up. Clean and well put together; a calming zen feeling at night that glows with confidence, tucked away in quiet little corner of the city. Enough geography and design; the menu is smart as in not the same old stuff but put together with care. The basics are amazing-spicy tuna, if so desired dressed up with papaya and avocado, subtly seasoned that you don't need the tub of soy with wasabi mixed in. The waitress, couldn't get her name, but absolutely beautiful and professional with an amazing smile. The toro was buttery smooth, Garlic Mackerel salty sweet and the salmon, oozing freshness with a rich silky taste. Just amazing. No glaring music and tattooed laden, overly pierced San Francisco wanna be artists, just polite professionals doing things right. I love this little gem tucked in the city. $60 + tip for two people without alcoholic bevs.   Go see for yourself.
author: H G.

description: Otoro is one of the best sushi places I've ever been to; the food is excellent, the services is great, and the atmosphere is very friendly.  The hirame carpaccio is BOMB, as well as the asparagus beef.  Say hi to the owner, and generally awesome guy, Jimmy, and ask for a sake recommendation.  Great spot for birthdays too.
author: L H.

description: Sushi is fresh, udon is really good, and the staff is really friendly.  Not out of the world, but definitely one of the better sushi places in Hayes Valley.
author: F S.

description: Irashyaimase. That's what you'll hear when you walk through the door of Hayes Valley's newest premier sushi/izakaya-inspired restaurant O-Toro, and to self-professed sushi connoisseurs, such as myself, that simple Japanese welcome can be music to our ears because it marks Chef Maki's conscientious gastronomic allusion to the culinary traditions of the motherland. The slither of the restaurant, with seating for only approximately 30 very lucky guests, embodies the spirit of contemporary Japan: striking balance between respect for established form and tradition while simultaneously extending open arms to contemporary cosmopolitanism.  The food at O-Toro is elegantly understated, remaining faithful to Japan's espousal of formal replication of the tried and true by using the freshest ingredients chosen at their seasonal peak and executed in a meticulous fashion, while adding subtle complexity to old favorites with the use of more unique ingredient pairings such as the delicate unfolding of flavors of their Hip Hop Roll - (warm shrimp tempura, avocado, followed by their signature garlic white tuna, scallion shavings and a punch of a crisp garlic chip for a powerful finish) or their Golden State Roll where Chef Maki forgoes the use of lemon juice and instead  tops his salmon with wafer-thin slices of fresh lemon fruit. Even the drink menu shares the love of old and new; the extensive list of Japanese sake, with the option to wet your lips on a flight of the day's tasting selections, is juxtaposed with new, hip lychee-sake cocktails and cucumber martinis perfect for the trendy restlessness of San Francisco's fashionable intelligence.  However, even as you are enjoying the very best of the Japanese's older traditions, like the lightly tossed ginger-dressed green salad or their satisfying Spicy Scallop Nigiri, the staff at O-Toro has made it a point to forsake some of the older stereotypes that accompany Japan's most infamous sushi spots. Unlike the traditional bullying mechanisms used by Japan's top chefs who promise to deliver top notch service only to those deserving of the honor (namely, those customers who are able to select their menu properly by researching and selecting freshest fish that is not only appropriate for the season, but also happens to have been the week's best catch in Tokyo's fish market.  Additionally, sushi selection should be ordered to allow the pallet to building upon itself over the course of the meal), Chef Maki and his staff have created a friendly and intimate space where sushi savants and neophytes can both share in what is sure to be San Francisco's new talk of the town. I believe that during the course of my meal, the patron sitting next to me actually smiled and gave me a big thumbs-up as slurped down his very large oysters on the half shell. It may have just been the excitement of opening night, but certainly, it is the camaraderie amongst fellow sushi lovers, along with the ability to taste fresh selections of the rare bluefin tuna, for which the restaurant is named (the same fish that made headlines by claiming six-figure prices at Tokyo's Tsukiji fish auction), that has started rumors that the sushi chefs from some of the Marina's hot sushi spots are actually traveling downtown to O-Toro on their days off.
author: Smartwater o.

description: Dinner for six at Otoro last night was a treat.  While it is seemingly new, it had the familiar feel of your go-to neighborhood sushi joint - you know, the place you keep going back to even though sometimes it gets too crowded, makes you wait, or runs out of your favorite fish.  You're willing to roll with the punches, because the owner (Jimmy) and the waitress (Eun-ji) feel like pals that are giving you their best.  The crowd was intimate, friendly, and energetic - sharing in and contributing to the neighborly vibe.  The food was delicious - sushi was fresh, rolls creative, cooked dishes flavorful.  Sake was free-flowing, affordable, and of appropriate quality for the menu.  We will be making it our go-to neighborhood sushi joint...even though it's a 30-minute drive away!
author: Young C.

description: Been to this place twice since opening and have enjoyed both experiences immensely.  Service was awesome.  Wait staff was very attentive and the owner, Jimmy, has a great sense of humor.  Besides the service, the menu offers a wide range of rolls/sashimi as well as cooked foods.  The Signature Otoro roll, Poki, and the Ramen are a few of my favorites.  What makes this restaurant so great is not just the extensive menu or the awesome service, but also the price.  The prices are extremely reasonable.  Let's be real, good japanese food can cost a pretty penny (I'm not talking about the cheap sushi joints that specialize in teriyaki chicken), but Otoro Sushi is very reasonably priced with high quality foods.  It definately made my short list of favorite restaurants!  =)
author: Elaine L.

description: the oysters were fresh and excellent.... everything we tried were delicately made and fresh........  the service was excellent...  they have a good selection of sake and wine.....  definately a good place to go for sushi and wine!  love it!!
author: samantha s.
